title: A One two many world
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Surrealism in motion pictures
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Adulthood
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Children and adults
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Children - Social conditions
Crafts & Visual Arts/Surrealism in motion pictures
description: A film of cinematic metaphor, made by students of Queen's University. The world of this film, one in which a growing boy finds himself, is a world of imposed conditions and contradictions. Here children turn adult by putting on the appropriate uniforms - the policeman's, the soldier's. Many of the sequences are surrealistic in effect, creating a social commentary expressed in symbolic language.
